alert.note: Alert for Adair; Audubon; Boone; Calhoun; Carroll; Cass; Crawford; Dallas; Greene; Guthrie; Hamilton; Jasper; Madison; Marshall; Polk; Poweshiek; Sac; Story; Tama; Webster (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 21 at 9:11PM CST until February 23 at 6:00PM CST by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...Significant Winter Storm Wednesday Into Thursday... .A large storm system will produce hazardous winter travel conditions across central and northern Iowa. Precipitation will begin mid-morning Wednesday and continue into Thursday. Heavy snowfall is likely in far northern Iowa with accumulations pushing eight inches or more close to the Minnesota and Iowa border. Strong winds will further aggravate difficult driving conditions by producing widespread blowing snow and visibility reductions to near a quarter mile at times. Mixed precipitation types are more of a concern to the south in central Iowa with a variety of snow, freezing rain, and sleet all possible. Ice accretions may approach or exceed a quarter inch over portions of central and east central Iowa. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM WEDNESDAY TO 6 PM CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow and sleet accumulations of 2 to 5 inches and ice accumulations of up to one quarter of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Portions of north central into central Iowa. * WHEN...From 9 AM Wednesday to 6 PM CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are possible due to the ice. Travel may become difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest travel conditions, check the Iowa 511 app, www.511ia.org, or dial 511.
